info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 3:41PM EDT until July 06 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Haywood County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Buncombe County in western North Carolina... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 341 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Waynesville, or near Canton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Canton, Clyde, Mount Pisgah, Leicester, Enka, Candler, Canto, Cruso, Bent Creek and West Asheville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
